title: helpers$1.extend is not a function
Font Awesome 5 fonts
body:
I'm trying to use the Font Awesome 5 Free fonts with this plugin without much success.

I have forked the solution from @simonbrunel (#25, thank you) and made some changes that I thought should work for the newer version of Font Awesome. Changing the font family and using the 5.0.1 CSS file from FA (https://use.fontawesome.com/releases/v5.0.1/css/all.css).

Here is the non working jsfiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/Lr6fqbu3/1/
Here is the working jsfiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/Lr6fqbu3/2/

But I'm left with boxes instead of the FA icons:

![2020-02-18_08-15-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1495123/74754759-f6bc6c80-5226-11ea-8454-a6a3ce9d286a.png)

Any help would be appreciated as I'm struggling to find a simple alternative method of applying datalabels to Charts.

Thanks.

---

**UPDATE** Wrapping the font family in double quotes was the magic sauce required:

```
family: '"Font Awesome 5 Free"'
```

![2020-02-18_08-31-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1495123/74756284-29fffb00-5229-11ea-91ad-9e9753dafd87.png)

title: Weblinks on your README are dead
body: Please change the location of your web links on the README.

title: Do not use helpers.canvas.roundedRect
body: This API is going away in Chart.js 3.0 since it's not used in the core library

title: Scriptable context options aligned with Chart.js
body:
In new Chart.Js version 2.9.x, there is a similar implementation of context.

In DataLabels there is:


active | bool | Whether the associated element is hovered
-- | -- | --

In [Chart.js](https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/general/options.html#option-context) there is:

hover: `true `if hovered

What do you think to be aligned with Chart.JS, renaming it in `hover` ?

title: How can you display dataLabels on top of the chart?
body:
I am using the dataLabels plugin to display datalabels on top of my charts. I managed to achieve this on a line chart as you can see here: https://codepen.io/paufar/pen/VOpZGQ

But when changing from a line to a bar chart, the dataLabels are no longer at the top of the chart. Anyway that this could be amended to cater for barcharts as well?

title: Pie DataLabel Error
Bug: Offset problem with bootstrap
Overlapping labels for smaller values
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7244749/63369488-15ac7580-c34e-11e9-8227-9475817daa57.png)

I've got some overlapping labels that I need to show, `overlap: "auto"` won't do the trick for me as my client needs the data to be shown. Is there any way to programatically set the positioning/padding of the labels? I've been playing around with different methods but I can't find a way to just push them a little further.

title: Can I have custom text?
body:
Hello

Instead of data inside the labels, for a polar chart, can I use this plugin to have my own text (preferably different text for each label)? I will show the legend default from chart.js anyway

Thanks in advance

R

title: bubble chart display data
Display multiple labels for one value
body:
Hello,
it would be really nice and useful to have option to display multiple labels for one value of the graph, so we would be able to create graphs like that one on the picture (first line is data value, second is label for this data).

![Image of graph](https://files.davidrychly.cz/multilabel_graph.png)

Possible solution to set the settings was already proposed here: [https://github.com/chartjs/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/issues/63#issuecomment-399784292](https://github.com/chartjs/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/issues/63#issuecomment-399784292)

title: Disable display for specific series
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12170723/61485853-8be94100-a978-11e9-83b4-b35d6e8ce52a.png)
We need to disable labels for the second series of our Charts. We can disable for specific dataset but not for specific series of all datasets. Checked all other issues but couldn't find answers.

We use override to set preferences for the second series of our chart but didn't really work.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12170723/61486112-1631a500-a979-11e9-943b-817d9ebbd307.png)

title: How to display image instead of label
body: Please suggest some propert to display image on the bar where label is being displayed using this plugin. Is it possible to display image alon with the label

title: pie chart - data labels - ERROR
Bug: Overlapping Labels
body:
Hello, 
i am having an issue with overlapping labels. 

I already tried to resolve that by changing the order of the dataset. 
If i put the Line Chart at the end of the dataset, the label of the line-chart is on top of the bar-chart (which would be correct) but the lines are behind the bar chart. 

It seems that chart.js itself is reading the dataset array different than chartjs-datalabels. 

Hiding the labels as they overlap is not an option.

In the Image below you can see the issue happening

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11938150/60983073-9d5b9900-a339-11e9-96c0-addbcdaa99a1.png)

title: Import error: "Module 'chartjs-plugin-datalabels/types/index' has no default export."
body:
Trying out Chart.js, and have been told I need to use the chartjs-plugin-datalabels to be able to write the percentage text on the piew pieces.

I installed and imported the `chartjs-plugin-datalabels` as per [the documentation](https://chartjs-plugin-datalabels.netlify.com/guide/getting-started.html#installation) into my Angular 7 project (actually Ionic 4, which uses Angular 7), but vscode reports the following error on the import...

`Module '"../../../../node_modules/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/types"' has no exported member 'ChartDataLabels'.ts(2`

I have the following versions
`
"chart.js": "^2.8.0",
"chartjs-plugin-datalabels": "^0.6.0",
`

If I go to the node_modules\chartjs-plugin-datalabels\types\index.d.ts file, I also see a similar error here for the line 

`declare module 'chart.js`

`Invalid module name in augmentation. Module 'chart.js' resolves to an untyped module at 'd:/dev/ionic/chartjstest/node_modules/chart.js/dist/Chart.js', which cannot be augmented.ts`

If I proceed, and try to run, I then get the compile error

`[ng] ERROR in node_modules/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/types/index.d.ts(5,16): error TS2665: Invalid module name in augmentation. Module 'chart.js' resolves to an untyped module at 'D:/dev/ionic/chartjstest/node_modules/chart.js/dist/Chart.js', which cannot be augmented.
[ng] src/app/home/pie-graph/pie-graph.component.ts(3,10): error TS2305: Module '"D:/dev/ionic/chartjstest/node_modules/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/types/index"' has no exported member 'ChartDataLabels'.`

title: What can I do to prevent the doughnut chart to show labels if the arc is too small for the label?
body:
I have an example here: https://jsfiddle.net/pu5o2ch3/.

In the example, you can see that one label is shown but is overlapping with other parts of the arc. Is there a way to prevent this and only show the value in the tooltip if the arc segement is to small for the text?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9639361/55778663-bbe49680-5aa3-11e9-8545-acf9740aedb5.png)

Please checkout https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55586373/how-can-i-show-texts-only-if-they-fit-in-the-arc-in-chart-js-2-8-0, too.

title: Adjusted misleading deprecation hint.
body:
Adjusted misleading deprectation hint in getting started --> registration page.

Fixes https://github.com/chartjs/chartjs-plugin-datalabels/issues/127.

title: Deprecation hint in Getting started --> Registration page is misleading for beginners
body:
The deprecation hint in the Getting started --> Registration page is a bit misleading. I guess `From version 1.x, this plugin will no longer be registered automatically (see #42 for details).` means `From version 1.x of Chart.Js, this plugin will no longer be registered automatically (see #42 for details).` and not `From version 1.x of chartjs-plugin-datalabels, this plugin will no longer be registered automatically (see #42 for details).`

In my opinion it should be stated more precisely that version 1.x of `Chart.Js` is referred and not version 1.x of the plugin (Which does not even exist at the moment). Check the link: https://chartjs-plugin-datalabels.netlify.com/guide/getting-started.html#registration

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9639361/55723866-6314ef80-5a0a-11e9-91df-b04d8b44982c.png)


I will provide a pull request for this.

title: Line Chart 'auto' Labels Overlap Issue
Option to show only total sum for stacked charts
body: In some stacked charts it is sufficient to show just the total value. It would be nice to have such an option. Details can always be shown in the tooltip (if enabled). If there are many series, stacked chart labels are overlapped (hard to read) anyway.

title: Cummulating values in the stacked charts
body:
If there are e.g. three series in the stacked bar chart, with labels shown at the top, I'd rather seen the subtotal values instead, so these correspond to the Y axis.

The current result is IMHO quite confusing:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3907898/55639022-c0b9f980-57c8-11e9-910a-afc773f74b0d.png)

The total value can be determined either roughly by projecting the top edge to the Y axis or precisely by calculating all of values. If there are lot of series, the latter method is not very user-friendly.

Currently the only workaround is to provide custom labels for all the values. However, this only works unless any dataset is hidden (as the recalculation is needed in this case).
